title: Mitsubishi Australia has recalled its best selling car model over safety fears
text:
Mitsubishi Australia has recalled a popular car model over fears that its steering could fail.

The Japanese car manufacturer was forced to recall the 2017-18 Mitsubishi Pajero NX due to a front suspension defect.

A total of 6384 affected vehicles, which were sold between November 21, 2016 and July 30, 2019 in Australia, have been recalled.

Mitsubishi Australia has been forced to recall the 2017-18 Mitsubishi Pajero NX due to safety concerns

The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission said due to inadequate wielding strength, the front right side suspension lower control arm may fail at one of the joints.

'If one of the lower control arm weld joints fails, the vehicle's steering and stability may not operate properly, increasing the risk of an accident or injury to all road users,' the ACCC said.

Customers can enter their VIN details to check whether the vehicle has been recalled.

Alternatively, the Japanese multinational will be contacting its customers via mail.

Customers are advised to take their vehicle into their preferred Mitsubishi dealership to have the vehicle repaired, free of charge.
